intro: Commiphora rostrata, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes other resin-producing plants like myrrh and frankincense. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and elliptical, leathery leaves. It produces a fragrant resin, which has been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes. Commiphora rostrata thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil.
